intro: Cylichnanthus, commonly known as the silverleaf shrub, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants typically have woody stems and are characterized by their opposite, ovate to lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. Cylichnanthus species produce small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. These plants are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive foliage and seasonal blooms.
